result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Mick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Daniel J. Mick was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel J. Mick is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Daniel J. Mick was found guilty of Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).
  • Daniel J. Mick was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Daniel J. Mick was found guilty of Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Comply with conditions as stated in Count 3

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*No contact with J.M.S.
*No contact with C.M., unless it is through her attorney 
*No contact with his own son until the child turns 18, and then only if the child wishes such contact after turning 18, unless is is pre-approved by agent and/or therapist.  Agent should be aware of the contact that has been going on between Defendant and son while case was pending and take into consideration.  Take best interest of child into consideration. 
*No contact with minors, unless it is pre-approved by agent and/or therapist 
*Any internet usage to be determined and/or approved by the agent in advance 
*Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry 
*Comply with any sex offender treatment recommendations 
*Participate with any other assessments, treatment and programming which may include mental health or psychosexual assessments as deemed appropriate by the Compass assessment and any other recommendations by the Department of Corrections 
*Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment so agent can monitor compliance 
*Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision 
*Provide DNA sample for testing if not already completed
*Comply with AODA assessments and any recommended treatment

Order Denying Supplemental Postconviction Motion and Motion to Reconsider /s/ TBE 03/11/21
Proposed Order Denying Supplemental Postconviction Motion and Motion to Reconsider filed by Atty Cole Daniel Ruby

IT IS ORDERED that the time to file the statement on transcript is extended to February 12, 2021.  The Clerk of the Circuit Court shall transmit the record to this court within twenty days of the filing of the transcript referenced in the statement on transcript.
IT IS ORDERED that the appellant's counsel shall file the statement on transcript and provide this court with a status update no later than January 19, 2021

01:33 PM Defendant Daniel J. Mick appeared by video. Attorney Cole Daniel Ruby appeared by video for Defendant Daniel J. Mick. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois appeared for State of Wisconsin. 

Matter is set for a hearing on the Wis. Stat. 974.06 Motion and Motion to Reconsider and State's Motion for Summary Dismissal.
Court has reviewed the Order denying the request for reconsideration, motions and responses that have been filed along with the supporting affidavits and documentation.  Court has also reviewed the trial transcript. 
Atty Ruby indicates he does not have any additional information other than what was submitted in his motion and briefs and would respond to any questions the court has. 
Court informs Atty Ruby with regards to the memory stick that was submitted and having not reviewed that for the reasons stated.  
Court questions Atty Ruby regarding allowing text messages and what would happen if those were allowed in. 
Atty Ruby responds. 
Atty Jambois makes arguments to the court.  
Atty Ruby responds.  
Court questions Atty Ruby further. 
Atty Jambois makes additional arguments. 
Atty Ruby makes additional arguments. 
Court questions Atty Ruby. 

BY THE COURT:  Court still believes the state's analysis is the correct analysis.  The court's initial decision was the correct decision.  Court will supplement that today.  
With regards to:
*Newly discovered evidence - Court does not believe that the evidence is particularly exculpatory but is in fact more inculpatory.  Court cannot find it meets factors the defendant must prove by clear and convincing   evidence.  The evidence was not discovered after conviction.  
*Negligence in seeking the evidence - Court cannot say he was negligent.
*Material issue to the case - More material to the states theory than the defendants because subsequent actions is contrary and even admitted to by the defendant. 
*Evidence cumulative - Court finds the evidence is not cumulative evidence.
*Deficient performance by his attorney - Court finds the burden has not been shown and there's a reasonable probability that the outcome would be different.
*Unused evidence by the defendant for attacking credibility or bias of Christina or motive of Christina to get the child to lie about assaults - Court finds defense counsel did an adequate job of impeaching Christina for credibility and bias. The additional unused facts, as described by counsel, were more the same type of evidence and defense counsel was fairly successful in drawing the jury's attention to the bias that Christina had.  
Court reviews the testimony of the defendant and Christina.Court finds any jury applying common sense would appreciate that the child's mother would be expected to be bias. Testimony of the child was an original part of the court's decision. 
*Hazeltine violations - Court does not change it's decision on that.  Court finds there were no Hazeltine violations.  No prejudice to the defendant that would change the outcome of the trial. 
*Defense argument and transcript - Court finds there was not a great possibility that the jury abdicated its fact finding role to the witness and did not independently find the defendant's guilt.
*Other acts evidence - Court has already addressed that.  Court finds, even without the greater latitude, evidence would have been admissible based on the allegations of both offenses charged.  Court finds there was no deficient performance for not raising an objection.  The objection would have been overruled.  
*Deficient performance of post-conviction counsel - Court finds there was no deficient performance by trial counsel and had no prejudicial effect.  
*Incorrect in applying stronger statute - Fails for a number of reasons.  Court did not deny motions solely because of clearly stronger.  Court finds clearly stronger is not a determining or mandatory factor.  Court stands by its original analysis.  
*Definition of cumulative - That is an evidentiary rule. C Court finds the unused evidence that the defendant counsel has request is additional evidence of bias or motive was sufficient and reasonable was done by counsel.  

In conclusion, court denies the defendants post conviction motion based on prior ruling and as supplemented by today.  Newly discovered evidence was not newly discovered. Court does not find that trial or appellate counsel were constitutionally defective.  

Atty Ruby makes statements as to what has not yet been addressed regarding production of cell phone for forensic examination by a defense expert. 
BY THE COURT:  Court, based on its ruling, is denying that. 

Atty Ruby will prepare the order consistent to the courts ruling.

Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by Atty Eric Sheets

Defendant Daniel J. Mick in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Daniel J. Mick in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is also present.

2:36 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matter is set for sentencing today.
Court has received a PSI completed by DOC.
Court provided copies to the PSI.
Parties received their copies.
State has one correction to state for the record.
Atty Sheets has reviewed the PSI with his client, has a couple corrections to state for the record.

There is no reason why the Court should not continue to sentencing today.
Court has received a number of letters from Defendant's family and mother of the child's family.
State has received a copy of the letters.
Defense has received a copy of the letters.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

2:43 PM C. M. addresses the Court.

Parties discuss next victim. Atty Sheets objects for reasons stated on the record. 
Grandparent of child does not fall under definition of victim as victim rights statutes define it. 

2:53 PM B Scroggins is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.

State has no further witnesses.

Atty Sheets has supplied letters to the Court already.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Sheets addresses the Court, makes sentencing recommendations.

3:34 PM Atty Sheets provides a copy of a letter to the State and to the Court, reads letter written by his client.
Defendant makes no statement to the Court prior to sentencing.

3:39 PM Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing. Court finds the PSI was very thorough and complete.
58 days credit


BY THE COURT:
Count 3:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 25 Years
Initial Confinement for 15 Years
Extended Supervision for 10 Years
58 days credit
Not eligible for challenge incarceration
Not eligible for substance abuse program
Conditions:
No contact with J.M.S.
No contact with C. M., unless it is through her attorney
No contact with own son until the child turns 18, and then only if the child wishes such contact after turning 18, unless it is pre-approved by agent and/or therapist. Agent should be aware of the contact that has been going on between Defendant and son while case was pending and take into consideration. Take best interest of child into consideration
No contact with minors, unless it is pre-approved by agent and/or therapist
Any internet usage to be determined and/or approved by the agent in advance
Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry 
Comply with any sex offender treatment recommendations
Participate any other assessments, treatment, and programming which may include mental health or psychosexual assessment as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and any other recommendations by the Department of Corrections
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment so agent can monitor compliance
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision
Comply with an AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full at least 90 days prior to discharge
Set up payment plan for payment of costs
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Costs may come from Defendant's wages and any bond posted
Obtain/maintain employment and/or schooling or a combination of both equal to fulltime as able
Provide DNA sample for testing if not already completed

Count 2:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 12 Years
Initial Confinement for 7 Years
Extended Supervision for 5 Years
Concurrent to Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 3
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 12 Years
Initial Confinement for 7 Years
Extended Supervision for 5 Years
Concurrent to Count 3 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 3 and Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge


Written copy of determinate sentence is given to the Defendant.
Parties will keep their copies of the PSI.

4:09 PM Atty Sheets addresses the Court as to to motion filed.
Court has received a copy of this motion. 
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, replies.
Atty Sheets addresses the Court, gives response.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies motion for release pending appeal.
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.

Day 3
Sentencing hearing on May 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel J. Mick in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:15 p.m.  Court is back in session outside the presence of the jury. 

4:17 p.m.  Jurors are escorted to the courtroom. 

Court reads the verdict.  The jury finds as follows: 
Count 1 - NOT GUILTY
Count 2 - GUILTY
Count 3 - GUILTY
Count 4 - GUILTY

Court individually polls the jurors.  

4:25 p.m.  Court addresses the jury, thanks them for their service and releases them at this time. 

Atty Knaapen moves to enter judgment on the verdicts. 
Atty Sheets does not object. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters judgment on the verdicts. 
Court orders PSI. 
PSI to be provided to the court and both parties atleast 1 week ahead of time. 

Atty Knaapen moves for the revocation of bond and that he be remanded into custody. 
Atty Sheets makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Bond is revoked.  
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant replies.
Court questions Atty Sheets for clarifications. Atty Sheets replies.
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, states the State's position.
Atty Sheets replies.
Marathon County case 15CV-846 is referenced.
State will work with Defense as to phrasing the wording.

Number 3 is addressed. Atty Sheets does not object. Court agrees.
Number 4 is addresssed. Atty Sheets does not object. Court agrees.
Number 5 is addresssed. Atty Sheets does not object. Court agrees.
Court reads remaining list.  Atty Sheets does not object.
BY THE COURT:
Court grants  3, 4, 5, 6 and 7.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, State is not intending to call the child.
Atty Sheets replies, child needs to be made available. 
State will have the child available. 
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, did talk with mother of child, mother has concerns. Mother has asked if child has to testify, that it be in another room.
Atty Sheets replies.
BY THE COURT:
Court will not have child testify outside the presence of the Defendant or the Jury unless there is specific information indicating that it would be harmful or detrimental to the child.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, has advised Defense that the Court has scheduled another matter on the same date, speedy trial that had to be held. State will contact this other attorney to see the status.

4:00 PM Case is concluded for today.

Defendant Daniel J. Mick in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:48 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
This hearing is set for motions filed by the parties to be heard today.
Atty Knaapen would indicate that the bond be modified and states this on the record.
State has complied with victim notification; no victims appear today in Court.
Atty Sheets makes statements.
Atty Sheets has a proposed order for the court to sign.
Court goes over the Motions in Limine with both parties and any changes are stated on the record.
Court questions Atty Knaapen if they should go over the Motion for Other Acts; Atty Knaapen makes statements.
Atty Knaapen makes further statements on the record. 
Court grants a portion of the motion for other acts and states this on the record; Atty Knaapen indicates that he has no other acts to provide.
Court continues to state on the record any portions of the motions that will be granted or excluded.
Court questions Atty Sheets if he had anything else on his Motions in Limine; Atty Sheets makes statement on the record.
Court questions Atty Knaapen in regards to the other acts motion; Atty Knaapen is satisfied.
Court questions Atty Sheets if his client wants his daughter to be put on the witness stand or appear via video.  
Atty Sheets takes a brief moment to speak with his client.
2:21 p.m.  Both Atty Sheets and his client have returned; appearances remain the same.
Atty Sheets is objecting to the admission of the video as it is not timely.
Court questions Atty Sheets if there is something that he needs to be aware of; Atty Sheets makes statements.
Court makes statements that all motions were to be filed by August 19, 2016; Court questions if there is a reason why the court should not dismiss this
motion.  Atty Knaapen makes statements.  
Court makes statements as to why he did not get the motions by August 19, 2016 when it was ordered; Atty Knaapen makes statement.
Court will now have to make a determination in regards to the minor child appearing in the courtroom as a witness as the State failed to file 
paperwork timely.

BY THE COURT: 
Court grants the motion for bond modification.  
Defendant would be able to have contact with his biological son.  
Court signs the order provided by Atty Sheets as of today's date.
State to provide the Court with a copy of the video in preparation of the hearing; this is to be provided within the week.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
